intro: Brownea birschellii, commonly known as the yellow-barked brownea, is a striking tropical plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, also known as the legume or pea family, and is characterized by its distinctive yellow bark and showy, pinkish-white flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 6 meters, and thrives in warm, humid climates. Its leaves are compound, consisting of several pairs of oval-shaped leaflets, and it produces elongated pods that contain several seeds. Due to its ornamental value, it is often cultivated in botanical gardens and tropical landscapes.
